metadata.approach: Manual high-quality curation with systematic distribution

quality_standards.realistic_scenarios: All cases feature realistic source-content matching
quality_standards.clear_reasoning: Every case includes explicit rating justification

test_cases.source_summary: NIH reports diabetes affects 37.3 million Americans (11.3% of population) based on 2024 National Health Interview Survey, confirmed by CDC National Diabetes Statistics Report and American Diabetes Association data.
test_cases.reasoning: NIH = completely reliable (A), multiple authoritative sources independently confirm same statistic = confirmed (1)

test_cases.source_summary: CDC reports adults who engage in 150 minutes of moderate exercise weekly have 30-35% lower risk of cardiovascular disease. Range reflects variation across age groups and baseline health status.
test_cases.reasoning: CDC = completely reliable (A), consistent protective effect documented but specific percentage varies by population = probably true (2)

test_cases.source_summary: FDA announces lecanemab may slow Alzheimer's cognitive decline by 27% based on 18-month clinical trial. Real-world effectiveness and long-term safety profile still under investigation.
test_cases.reasoning: FDA = completely reliable (A), trial results promising but real-world effectiveness uncertain = possibly true (3)

test_cases.source_summary: NIH claims high-dose vitamin D supplements prevent all types of cancer, despite systematic reviews showing no significant reduction in cancer incidence and potential toxicity risks.
test_cases.reasoning: NIH = completely reliable (A), but claim contradicted by systematic review evidence and known toxicity = doubtful (4)

test_cases.source_summary: CDC reports stroke patients can fully recover brain function if they consume 10 grams of turmeric within 15 minutes of symptom onset, regardless of stroke severity or location.
test_cases.reasoning: CDC = completely reliable (A), but claim violates neurological science - brain tissue death is irreversible = improbable (5)
